main event: A patrolman and ground radar at the Grand Prairie Air Force Base in Dallas observed an unidentified flying object (UFO) with bright, pulsating lights at high altitude. The object moved erratically, accelerated, and disappeared after 45 minutes.
interesting points: The ground radar confirmed the presence of the UFO in the vicinity of the patrol car, indicating the object's physical existence.
Further investigation suggested that the object was under intelligent control and was performing strange maneuvers, but no satisfactory explanation was found.
The report includes details such as the equipment used (ground radar), the duration of the sighting (45 minutes), and the course and direction of the UFO (SW to NE).
The sighting occurred at 1:15 AM, and the observations were made by a patrolman named Edilen in Dallas, Texas.
The report also mentions the presence of handwritten notes providing additional commentary and analysis related to the UFO sighting.
sighted object: bright, pulsating lights at high altitude
witnesses: Patrolman Edilen, ground radar at the Grand Prairie Air Force Base
